meanings.definition: The state or quality of being homogenous.
meanings.sent1: The homogony of the colors in the painting created a sense of harmony.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the homogony of the soil samples to understand their composition.
meanings.sent3: The homogony of flavors in the dish made it a delightful culinary experience.
meanings.sent4: The homogony of opinions among the group led to a unanimous decision.
meanings.sent5: The homogony of the music and dance performance mesmerized the audience.

meanings.definition: The tendency of similar individuals to associate or group together.
meanings.sent1: In nature, the homogony of birds of the same species is often observed during migration.
meanings.sent2: The homogony of students with common interests formed strong friendships in the class.
meanings.sent3: The homogony of book lovers at the library book club made for lively discussions.
meanings.sent4: The homogony of athletes in the team improved their coordination and teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The homogony of colors in the artwork brought together different elements beautifully.
